channel.title: How to set how much RAM a server uses
channel.description:
This is a pretty basic tutorial on how to set how much RAM your server/client uses.
First of find your run.bat or whatever you use to start your server. Right click and click edit. It should have something like this.
Server: [code]@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause[/code]
Client: [code]@echo off title Client java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause [/code] It could be a little different depending on your server/client. Now look for [code]java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32[/code]
The Xmx512m could be different but that is how much reserved RAM your server or client is using. Change that to higher if you want it to run faster or lower it if you want it to use less RAM.
You can also speed up a client by running it then pressing ctrl + alt + del. Click the processes tab and find the javaw process. Right click it and click set priority then higher or lower depending on how much speed you want it to have.
If I missed something or something is incorrect please tell me and I will change it. Thanks

item.title: How to set how much RAM a server uses
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Please learn what you’re talking about before posting a tutorial, we don’t need to teach people the wrong information.

Even if what you posted was correct Id still lock it since it should be basic knowledge.

Read full topic
item.source: How to set how much RAM a server uses

item.title: How to set how much RAM a server uses
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Loveandpower:

Common knowledge really nothing else to be said…

And he didn’t even explain it correctly.

-Xmx512m doesn’t reserve any RAM for the JVM. Nor does increasing the number “speed up” the process. It set’s the MAXIMUM amount of RAM that the JVM can allocate for heap space.

Read full topic
item.source: How to set how much RAM a server uses

item.title: How to set how much RAM a server uses
item.dc:creator: @triger545 triger545
item.description:
@triger545 wrote:

This is a pretty basic tutorial on how to set how much RAM your server/client uses.

First of find your run.bat or whatever you use to start your server. Right click and click edit. It should have something like this.

Server: @echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

Client: @echo off title Client java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause
It could be a little different depending on your server/client.
Now look for java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32

The Xmx512m could be different but that is how much reserved RAM your server or client is using. Change that to higher if you want it to run faster or lower it if you want it to use less RAM.

You can also speed up a client by running it then pressing ctrl + alt + del. Click the processes tab and find the javaw process. Right click it and click set priority then higher or lower depending on how much speed you want it to have.

If I missed something or something is incorrect please tell me and I will change it. Thanks
